inclusion.criterion: proven diagnosis of BE by high resolution computed tomography
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: stable pulmonary status as indicated by FEV1 ≥30%
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: stable regimen of standard treatment for BE
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg, one puff twice daily.

inclusion.criterion: ability to follow the inhaler device instructions
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: known intolerance for ICS or LABA
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: women who are pregnant, lactating, or in whom pregnancy cannot be excluded
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: expected to die within 72 hours after enrolment
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 39-year-old man with cough and shortness of breath, history of asthma for 3 years. Symptoms improve outside the workplace.
